notes:
* Snowflake Connector (+ Sample Configs): You can now connect directly to Snowflake from the connectors list. And because nobody enjoys staring at a blank config screen wondering what goes where, we've added sample connection configs for most connectors so you can test things out without the guesswork.

* AI SQL Editor (Beta): You still don't need to know SQL. We just got better at it. Describe what you need in plain English and we'll handle the rest: merging sheets, cleaning messy data, building filtered views from raw sources. Your results show up in a fresh sheet you can tweak, re-run, or refresh whenever your source data changes. We speak SQL so you never have to. This one's a premium feature. Drop us a message to get it enabled.

* Single Window Architecture: The app used to run across three separate windows for the splash screen, onboarding and the main interface. That worked fine until macOS 26 decided it didn't like our multi-window setup anymore. So we've consolidated everything into one clean full-screen window. Fewer moving parts, fewer crashes and better vibes.

* Recent Activity Tracking: Your project list now sorts by what you actually worked on last, and jumping between screens brings you right back to the tab you were on. Less time re-orienting, more time doing the thing you came here to do.

Fixes. 

* Editing messages in the chat container works again (a regression from the last release broke it, and we're sorry about that).

* Downloading your connector config no longer exposes database passwords in plain text. Sensitive fields are now obfuscated in the exported JSON, because shipping credentials in a config file is the kind of surprise nobody needs.
